page.title: 11Glendale School in Wooler
page.content: The School was opened 31.8.1953.There were 180 pupils.The staff were paid 15/6 or 77p per day.Miss.E.Jackson,who retired in 1984,was originally,the only permanent female member of staff.The Headmaster was Mr.Robson.He was followed by Mr. Moore who retired in 1983.Mr.Spowart is the present Head.The school used to run courses on agriculture and had its own small farm.Today the land and buildings are rented by a local farmer.Courses are still held in the school but run by Kirkley Hall.There are 198 pupils at the school today, travelling from a catchment area of 200 square miles.The school is essentially a community one, providing a centre for youth activiti- es and a wide range of adult evening classes.It is also used by other local organisations for various events.
